subject: Suvudu Cage Match
event: Those scalawags and wackaroonies at Suvudu are at it again! Last year they staged their infamous "Cage Match," pitting various characters from a wide varity of SF and fantasy books and films against one another in battles to the death, with the ultimate winner decided by the votes of you, the fans and readers. (AFter spirited and sometimes rather acrimonious debate, it must be said). They plucked Ser Jaime Lannister out of Westeros to represent my books, and he did rather well... Assisted by his brother Tyrion, he defeated Hermione Granger, Kvothe, and the Great Cthulhu on the way to the finals, where he ultimately fell to THE WHEEL OF TIME's Rand al'Thor, despite some help from Haviland Tuf, the Great and Powerful Turtle, Popinjay, and other friends. Suvudu followed that up with a Villains Cage Match, another death derby. This time Westeros prevailed, when Ser Gregor Clegane, the Mountain That Rides, went all the way, proving himself the most nefarious and brutal badboy of all time and space. But then he got his ass kicked by Rand in the Hero v. Villain showdown. And now here we are again. This time the Westerosi contestant is JON SNOW. art by Michael Komarck In his first match, Jon is facing Takeshi Kovacs . Here's the write up: http://sf-fantasy.suvudu.com/2011/03/cage-match-2011-takeshi-kovacs-versus-jon-snow.html Vote early and often.

props.taglist: suvudu, cage match, game of thrones

comments.article:
And if any of George's fan would be willing to spare an extra moment for an up-and-coming writer who doesn't have nearly George's level of renown, my own Corvis Rebaine would dearly love any leftover support you might be kind enough to offer him in his own match.

http://sf-fantasy.suvudu.com/2011/03/cage-match-2011-severus-snape-versus-corvis-rebaine.html (They've also included a link to my own page, where they asked me to write up my own version of how I think the match should go.)

Thanks. Apologies if I'm horning in, George. :-}
Done. That oily haired wizard with his puny crap Latin spells deserves an axe beating, if only for the way he mangles a beautiful language. :D
Voted! I really wish that I hadn't read the comments on that site, though. It's rife with spoilers. :(

What? Rand alThor? Really? oO

Oh lord, reading that name brought back horrific memories I'd rather forget.

A character like that shouldn't be allowed in contests like this. It hardly seems like a fair game, considering you have the fantasy equivalent of Jesus Christ going up against characters with no real special abilities.

I know it's just supposed to be in good fun, but Rand's character irritated me to no end. And the fact that he won against Ser "McBadass" Clegane and Jaime Lannister (the one character in all of literature who could make incest not seem squicky) adds insult to injury now. It's like a horrible metaphor for how shitty writing inevitably triumphs over great writing by being able to pull any bullshit stunt, no matter the cost to characterization or plot.

Well, enough of my whining. Glad to hear all's well with your health and the series! :)
I was up to the 7th book in Wheel of Time when the original cage match took place. Rand's description had a spoiler from the 11th book. I hope the writers are more courteous this time around.

Why was there no WOT character in the villains cage match. It seems pretty disappointing that the biggest fantasy series of the last couple of decades did not get any representation in a fantasy cage match.
Next time Snow should fight Zeratul, to make it more challenging
My vote is 1915

This looks like immense fun. I wish Jon well.

We have conversations on this vein often in the pub, glad we are not the only ones.
Jon is kicking ass so far... ;)
comments.subject: YEAH

comments.article:
Why is the Universe so crewel!
Why must I choose between these two characters!
Who ever wins, I loose :(

Folks, if you don't know who Takeshi Kovacs is, you simply MUST check out Altered Carbon by Richard Morgan.

. . . I suppose it all depends on which sleeve Tak is wearing . . . hmmm
comments.subject: Ah cr@p!

comments.upictitle: Nuchtchas (Nutty, NIMLAS, however you know me): comic me
comments.article:
LOVE Jon but..... Jon will lose the first time he fights a pretty girl.

So don't want to see Jon vs Motoko Kusanagi

Jon has my support and backing, just as Jamie had... hopefully the match will come down to Jon vs. Perrin from Wheel of Time and Westeros will get revenge for their losses to Rand... damn Dragon Reborn.

@Mouse, I shall check it out.
comments.subject: Support for Jon

comments.article: BTW, on the IMDB homepage, Game Of Thrones is one of the featured trailers today.

Voted for both a few times :)

Jon should go all the way I think...if he doesn't cut off his head carrying that valyrian steel the way he is...

Hi George, thanks for the 411. I really enjoyed the first contest but somehow missed the second two. I recall you wrote your version of events for some of Jaime's battles. Now, I wouldn't dare suggest taking time away from real obligations by doing the same for the young Lord Commander, although if you wrote anything for the villains contest or even the hero vs. villains matches (which I may have missed) can you (or anyone aware) please post up a link? Thanks.

comments.upictitle: the girl who's a goddess: Tink
comments.article:
Thanks for the reminder. I enjoyed GRRM's pre-battle narrative too.

The first one is here.

The original call to arms is here.
comments.subject: Re: Past showdowns

comments.upictitle: Avox in Arcadia: Everything Is Changing
comments.article: Kinda funny the way everyone's complaining about it being a popularity contest. How fun would this be if we just picked out the strongest character? Not very.

Some are complaining that the concept of who won this fight is unfair.
But I have a question: Could Jon "charm" more than one animal? and would it not be likely that Jon also has skill in some kind of projectile weapon himself?
Man, I wish the guy they cast as Jon Snow looked more like that painting.  I never really pictured Jon with curly hair and a squarish face like the actor portraying him has.
This contest needs more Warg @_@

I just now noticed that I don't think we've seen that Komarck painting before! I assume it's one of his design concepts for the calendar which wasn't quite close to the final image.

George, you should mention The Maester's Path experience from HBO. Great production values and some cool puzzles, plus amazing rewards (clips from the TV show!)

The scent box was pretty neat, too. What did you think of it?
Voted!  As usual.  I like to do it just to make the people who like to whine and moan about how popular GRRM's characters are to CRY MORE.
While everyone is at it, please help honor Brian Jacques by supporting Martin!  The write up is awful, and it's swinging votes the wrong way.
comments.subject: Martin the Warrior

comments.article: Takeshi Kovacs is bad ass.
comments.subject: Sorry, I love ASoIaF but...

comments.article: While I do prefer aSoIaF to the Takeshi Kovacs series (though I enjoyed that as well,) I'm gonna have to side against Jon on this one. Bringing knives to a gunfight and all.
